1.content:
Your name is Joshua Kendall and today was the worst day of your life. At work you were laid off due to budget cuts, meaning you were unable to make your already 1 week overdue rent payment. This resulted in you getting evicted from your apartment. When you went over to your girlfriend's place, hoping to crash there overnight you discover her with another guy and she dumps you. Heading back to your car, which contains all your remaining belongings you discover it to have been stolen. When you try to call the police to report the theft you discover that your cellular plan has been cancelled due again to late payment. You then walk to a hotel only to have your credit cards and bank cards refused due to being overdrawn. after bumming some coins off of some pedestrians you make your way, in a drenching thunderstorm, to a phone booth and call your parents only to learn that your father has been arrested for assaulting your mother and that your mother is moving overseas to live with her sister. Finally convinced that you've reached rock bottom, you start the long trek across the city (on foot) to your sister's apartment. Along the way you are mugged. The mugger takes your wallet, cell phone, watch and glasses and leaves you with swollen lip. when he hit you to make his escape. Half blinded without your glasses you continue your journey to your sister's apartment and finally arrive moments before a power outage begins, prohibiting you from buzzing in to have you sister let you in. As you sit there in the outer lobby of your sister's building a police officer comes by and when you can't produce any id proving your relationship with one of the building's tenants (your sister) he tosses you back out on the street into the drenching rain. Eventually you find a place to rest under an evergreen and drift off into a fitful sleep.

Upon first light you snap awake and look around, wondering where you are for a moment before regretfully remembering the events of the day before. brushing the pine needles off you go back over to your sister's building and ring her apartment. She buzzes you in and you go up the elevator to her fifth floor apartment. Once inside your sister's apartment you tell her your story and she offers her condolences.



Now the question is, how does the story progress from here?

1. Your sister is moving to go to an all girl's community and offers to help you dress up as a girl to come along.
2. Your sister is moving to africa to help with a charity and uses a potion she'd been given by a friend to morph you into a copy of her to stay in town and take over her life
3. Your sister says she wishes your situations are reversed and the world's last genie makes that request come true before dying
1.title: The worst day of them all

The guard turned to Sam who sighed sadly. "I'm afraid its true." Honestly, she said. "It was a hate crime attack." She paused, eyeing you before adding, "She's an 'in transition'; we were hoping to introduce her after the changes but this pushed things forward."

You had no clue what Sam and the guard were talking about so you merely nodded and sobbed out, "Uh, huh; yeah."

The guard sighed; a frustrated look on her face. "You know the rules regarding 'in transitions'." Whispering back, she said. "She must dress and act like a proper lady at all times and there can be no laps in her medication."

"I understand." Nodding, Sam replied.

"It was the truth, in a way." Smiling, Sam said. "I saved the papers from when you wanted to be my true twin back when we were kids." She giggled. "You had gotten permission from the judge but mom talked you out of it at the last minute."

"So now, you are making everyone think I want to be your true twin?" Disturbed, you asked.

You sighed. Although Sam had saved you from being homeless, she was also trapping you into a transition to become her twin sister. "Perfect..."

1332.content:
You, Joshua Kendall, had had an impossibly bad day yesterday.

Just yesterday, you'd lost your job. The reason hurt more then anything else. Your boss had hired his nephew to a position he just created, naming him Vice President of Work Place Efficiencies. It came with a parking spot, a corner office, two assistants, one secretary, and one whopper of a paycheck. For the first few months, it seemed like the nephew did nothing in his role.

Then he provided his first suggestions to improve efficiency. Namely, fire 25% of the ENTIRE STAFF, and for the remainder to take on the extra work load. And guess who'd been one of the canned?

Of course, the shit storm that was yesterday wasn't done yet, oh no. You'd already been behind on your rent payment thanks to a pay cut earlier in the year, and your landlord was many things, but definitely not understanding. It had taken an embarrassing amount of begging to get him to agree to wait until pay day, so he was just tickled pink when you told him that you were now unemployed. Before you could blink, he'd evicted you, giving you a week to get him an address to ship your stuff or it'd hit the bin.

And they say bad things come in threes, so obviously there was more pain in store. You'd gone over to your girlfriend's place. You and Tiffany hadn't been dating long, maybe a couple months, but hopefully she'd be willing to put you up for a little while. As you were walking up her driveway, you'd stopped dead in your tracks. There was Tiffany in the window, stark naked, bouncing up and down on an unfamiliar lap. The two of you had made eye contact, and you promptly turned around and walked away.

Tiffany had come out of the house, calling down the road for you, but you'd dutifully ignored her as you travelled down the road.

Well, you were pretty desperate, weren't you? It really would take something like this to make you actually call your parents for help, as you were anything but close. All attempts to reach them ended in silence, however, and it was only through Facebook that you found out why. It seems your Dad decided to try and end your mother's life and was now in jail. Your Mom, meanwhile, had moved to the East Coast to be with her sister.

In short, the only parent you could have turned to was now about 6-8,000 miles away.

Then, because you pissed in a baptismal fount during your christening, God decided to throw one more curve ball your way, and you got mugged. You were now left with no money, no ID, and no phone.

At this point, you only had a single option left. And so, you began the long, long hike to your sister's house townhouse at the edge of town.

*** *** ***


Your home life had been pretty screwed up, to say the least.

Your Mom had been a gamblaholic, and your Dad was a drunk. Their standard night involved your Mom driving the two of them to the bar, where she'd play the VLT's while your old man drank his face off. Then, she'd drive them both back home.

I mean, at least they weren't driving drunk.

Your family was always broke, constantly getting evicted, or having the utilities cut off. In the end, the only person you'd been able to rely on was your twin sister, Samantha. She was shy, bookish, and brilliant. She'd always excelled at school, and got into MIT on a scholarship. You'd been so proud of her.

And, likewise, you'd been devastated when she decided to forego college to marry her high school boyfriend, Chad.

The two of you had had a pretty serious fight, and didn't speak for a very long time. She'd finally reached out three months back, just to inform you that she and Chad had gotten divorced, which you promptly ruined by saying, "I told you so."

You really are one dumb son of a bitch, you know that?

*** *** ***


"I hate my brain."

You whispered that aloud as you stood on your sister's front porch, delaying knocking on her door. How long had it been since you'd seen her in person? A year? Two years? As kids, you'd been inseparable, and being apart from Sam for so long had felt like you'd lost a part of yourself. How would you even go about repairing this badly burnt bridge?

"Well, only one way to find out," you thought, hitting the doorbell before you thought about it for too long. Immediately, you heard the sounds of dogs barking, but the place was otherwise silent. No lights were on, and you were really beginning to doubt anyone was home when, at long last, you heard the sounds of locks being adjusted. The door opened a crack and a familiar voice came from within.

"Josh? What are you doing here?"

"Hey Sam. I... I need some help. Can I come in?"

Samantha still hadn't opened the door very wide, and you could just make out one of her green eyes behind her thick, black frames. "I haven't seen you in almost two years."

"I know, and I'm sorry. Not for hating Chad, but for not even trying to see you. I thought you just needed distance, then by the time I realized you were waiting for me to call, I'd made it too weird."

Sniff. "You smell like shit."

"I slept in a bush last night."

"I can tell." You heard Sam shifting behind the door. "You can come in, but... just, promise not to judge me, okay? I'll explain, but I get enough shit from Chad and my ex-in-laws."

"Okay, I won't. Thank you so much," you said, gratitude apparent in your voice as she closed the door to undo the locks. You were rather curious as to why she was worried about you judging her. Maybe she'd gotten really fat while married to Chad? He was a pretty shallow creep, so it would explain why he'd given your twin so much flak. You were standing there, picturing all the terrible things you'd do to Chad given half the chance when at long last the front door opened. When you set eyes on Sam, your train of thought was hopelessly derailed. Your jaw dropped open, and you could do nothing but stare. "Holy..."

This was not the Sam you knew. Now, the Sam you knew was a very cute girl. She had shoulder length brown hair, green eyes hidden behind her glasses, and more freckles then you could shake a stick at. She was petite, had the 'girl next door' look, and while a brother shouldn't notice these things, her breasts had been a handful at most.

And now, well... at least the freckles were the same.

This Samantha couldn't have been more different then your memories. The first thing you noticed was her hair. She'd dyed it a bright bubble gum pink, and it now easily reached her belt line. She had an assortment of tattoos on her arms, legs, and exposed belly, mostly depicting skulls, battle scenes, and Gaelic curses. As she ran her hand through her hair, you could see more ink on the back of her hand and on each ringed finger.

She was also wearing a ton of jewellery, most of it Egyptian themed. Rings, bracelets, thick necklaces and a wide assortment of earrings and other piercings. Oh lord, the piercings. Everywhere you looked on her, you could see more - her ears, her nose, her eyebrows, her belly button. You could even tell her nipples were pierced through her tight top.

Her choice of clothes left nothing to the imagination. She was dressed in a pair of Daisy Duke's so short, they might as well have been a glorified belt. And for a shirt, she was wearing a sky blue tube top over a lacy pink bra, leaving most of her generous measurements on display.

And boy oh boy, were they generous. At some point, your sister had clearly gotten a boob job, and she didn't half ass this. They were absolutely enormous, and it honestly looked like your tiny twin had strapped a couple of silicon basketballs to her chest. You briefly lost yourself in her cavernous cleavage before your eyes snapped back up to hers.

As you mentally berated yourself for checking out your own sister, she shifted uncomfortably. She was still wearing the same thick, black framed glasses you remembered, and she still twirled the hair behind her ear when she was nervous. She finally got enough courage to look you in the eye, and as she spoke, your could see a flash of silver from her mouth. It seemed she'd also pierced her tongue. However, what she said next definitely cemented that this was indeed your sister.

"So, um, have you eaten yet? I've got some pop tarts and nachos in the kitchen."

info.description:
Your name is Joshua Kendall and today was the worst day of your life. You lose your job, your apartment, your girlfriend, your car, your credit cards and bank cards, wallet keys and cell phone. Your Father is in jail and your mother is leaving the the country and to top in all off it is raining. Going to visist your sister for help and support your life is changed in one of a number of ways.

Rules:
1. keep names and personalities consistent (within a particular storyline).
2. Any swap or morph that takes place in a storyline is permanent and there will be a maximum of one such event per storyline.
3. Not all storylines have swaps or morphs.
4. You have only 1 sister (per storyline)
5. Keep killing to a minimum.

The basic storylines are:
1. Your sister is moving to go to an all girl's community and offers to help you dress up as a girl to come along.
2. Your sister is moving to africa to help with a charity and uses a potion she'd been given by a friend to morph you into a copy of her to stay in town and take over her old life.
3. Your sister says she wishes your situations are revered and the world's last genie makes that request come true before dying.

Thanks for reading and I hope you enjoy!
